intro: Oxydectes capitata, commonly known as the Cape tulip, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features showy, daisy-like blooms with yellow centers and pink to purple petals. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for gardens. Oxydectes capitata is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
